title: Petra Capital raising for Strike Energy
text:
Petra Capital is out raising for South Australia-based oil and gas explorer Strike Energy.

John Poynton spearheads a heavyweight board at Strike Energy. Erin Jonasson

The company is looking to raise $35 million via a $30 million single tranche institutional placement and a $5 million share purchase plan.

The placement issue price is 23¢, a 4.2 per cent discount to Strike's last close.

The company will use the equity to fund an exploration and appraisal program in the Perth basin, according to terms sent to fund managers.

The placement book closes on Thursday at 3pm. The deal launched after market on Tuesday.

Petra Capital is the sole lead manager and bookrunner. Street Talk first flagged the raising on October 10.

Strike's board is stacked with well known names in business including ex-Fortescue Metals CEO Nev Power, RBA board member John Poynton and colourful Queensland dealmaker Stephen Bizzell.
